detachmentRule.name: death optimisation
detachmentRule.lore: Hunter Cohorts combine a mastery of stealth warfare and cogitational analysis with stealth screen projectors and target-fouling apparatuses. They are elusive foes to face, and especially sinister to those they have designated as prey.
detachmentRule.description: SKITARII INFANTRY, SKITARII MOUNTED and IRONSTRIDER BALLISTARII units from your army have the Stealth ability, and each time a ranged attack targets a SICARIAN unit from your army, unless the attacking model is within 12'', the target has the Benefit of Cover against that attack.

enhacements.name: Cantic Thrallnet
enhacements.lore: Proclaimed to be a direct data-link to the will of the Omnissiah himself, this neuro-entanglement matrix allows for hyper-optimised combat cogitation.
enhacements.description: SKITARII MARSHAL model only. At the start of the battle round, you can select one friendly SKITARII unit within 12'' of the bearer. Until the start of the next battle round, the Protector Imperative and the Conqueror Imperative are both active for that unit.

enhacements.name: Clandestine Infiltrator
enhacements.lore: Under cover of auspex scramblers, this holy soldier leads their fellows in a stealthy advance.
enhacements.description: SKITARII model only. The bearer, and models in any unit they are leading, have the Infiltrators and Scouts 6'' abilities.

enhacements.name: Veiled Hunter
enhacements.lore: In silent supplication, a concentrated burst of noospheric negation manifests as a heavy band of shadow. Under this shroud, this commanders warriors obfuscate the foe’s sensors and confuse their strategy.
enhacements.description: SKITARII MARSHAL model only. After both players have deployed their armies and determined who has the first turn, you can select up to three SKITARII INFANTRY units from your army and redeploy all of those units. When doing so, any of those units can be placed into Strategic Reserves, regardless of how many units are already in Strategic Reserves.

enhacements.name: Battle-sphere Uplink
enhacements.lore: Tapping into infostacks of data emanating from across the wider battle-sphere, this experienced Skitarius synchronises with the flow of wisdom, drawing upon data that enables near-prophetic reactions.
enhacements.description: SKITARII model only. In your Shooting phase, after the bearer’s unit has shot, if it is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, that unit can make a Normal move of up to 6''. If it does, until the end of the turn, that unit is not eligible to declare a charge.

stratagems.name: bionic endurance
stratagems.lore: Between their multi-layered bionics and their fanatical faith in the indomitability of these machine-blessings, the most augmented of Skitarii are nigh-impossible to lay low.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase orthe Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One SICARIAN, PTERAXII or SYDONIAN unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: One SICARIAN, PTERAXII or SYDONIAN unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.

stratagems.name: binharic offence
stratagems.lore: These warrior organisms destroy all as their adrenaline surges.
stratagems.when: The start of your Shooting phase or the start of the Fight phase.
stratagems.target: Two SKITARII units from your army that have not been selected to shoot or fight this phase, and one enemy unit.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of weapons equipped by models in both of your units by 1.
stratagems.restrictions: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in either of your units makes an attack, it can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target].

stratagems.name: expedited purge protocol
stratagems.lore: Binharic imperatives flash through neural architecture, driving augmetic muscle-bundles and auto-actuators into overdrive to propel the Skitarii more swiftly into the fray.
stratagems.target: One SKITARII unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

stratagems.name: isolate and destroy
stratagems.lore: The swiftest hunters seek to engage foes with the equations of war in their favour, isolating their quarry and dispatching it with ruthless efficiency.
stratagems.target: One SICARIAN, PTERAXII, SYDONIAN, IRONSTRIDER BALLISTARII Or SKITARII MOUNTED unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, if there are no other enemy units within 6'' of the unit targeted by that attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.

stratagems.name: shroud protocols
stratagems.lore: When Skitarii Hunter Cohorts march to war, they do so beneath a shrouding squall of cyber-static and filament-heavy banks of sacred incense.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.target: One SKITARII INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit can only be selected as the target of a ranged attack if the attacking model is within 12''.

stratagems.name: programmed withdrawal
stratagems.lore: Taking direct control of their cybernetic soldiers’ manoeuvres, the cohort’s commander sees their withdrawal carried out with such precision that they can be pressed back into service from the most efficacious of attack vectors.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.target: Up to two SICARIAN units from your army, or one SKITARII INFANTRY or SKITARII MOUNTED unit from your army
stratagems.effect: Remove those units from the battlefield and place them into Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.restrictions: Each unit targeted with this Stratagem must be more than 3'' away from all enemy units.
